intro: Sphalmanthus bijliae, commonly known as the Bijliya dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in small, spherical inflorescences. Sphalmanthus bijliae is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
